page.title: 12THE HILL LAND ON EDAY
page.content: Most hill land on Eday, which is now grassland, started off as wild heather. To reclaim this land for farming, first you have to pace out your piece of land, then you burn off the heather. When burning heather you must keep a constant watch on the flames because the wind could spread the flame and the fire could go out of control. When the fire is put out it is time to plough. You start by going down and up the hill. When it is ploughed it must be seeded. After the seeding comes harrowing. Then last of all you have to roll the ground and wait for the grass to grow. Many farmers on the West Side of Eday have just taken out hill in this way.
